intro: Cyrtosia taiwanica, commonly known as the Taiwan cyrtosia, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with red stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
